text: 30 Bridge Street, Usk, Monmouthshire, is a Grade II* listed building. ==History and description== The original building formed part of the hospital of Usk Priory. The roof of the present building dates from c.1400. From the 17th century, the building was used as a gaol and the Catholic martyr David Lewis, aka Father Baker was imprisoned there in the 1680s. The architectural historian John Newman; who refers to the building as No.28 , to which No.30 is joined and held in single ownership; notes the "hoodmould and idiosyncratic spurred stops" as the architectural features which enable dating to the early 15th century. ==Notes== == References == * Category:Buildings and structures in Monmouthshire Category:Grade II* listed buildings in Monmouthshire
